answers.author: Richard Brown
answers.text:
It is clearly problematic as it relates to the ICMA code of ethics.  The elected official while serving as DCA and the prior political involvement violates our code.  I suspect the incumbent will not try to pursue ICMA membership.  It is also interesting to note that the hiring authority was removed from the county manager and now resides with the Board of Supervisors.

author: Matthew Reges
text:
A state legislator accepts appointment to the role of deputy county administrator, intending to hold both positions, full-time local manager and part-time state legislator representing part of the same county. How does this situation align with ICMA ethics guidelines?  What would the gentleman need to do to avoid appearance of conflict of interest? 
The news story appears in today's (Fredericksburg, VA) Free Lance-Star: http://news.fredericksburg.com/spotsygovt/2012/12/11/republican-del-mark-cole-named-spotsys-new-deputy-county-administrator/
title: Ethics of concurrent state legislative and local management roles
